I approached the City on January 4. Nothing 2 could be more complimentary than the way Ι was met by a procession. But my arrival coincided with a very conflagration of civil discord, or rather civil war 3 and though I had the eager desire, and I believe, the power, to find a remedy for it, I was thwarted by the passionate desires of certain men 3 for there are those on both sides who desire to fight. To sum up, Caesar himself too, our former friend, has sent a threatening and disagreeable despatch to the Senate, and is still so insolent as to defy the Senate in retain- ing his army and province ; and my old friend Curio eggs him on. Our friend Antony indeed and Q.
